event_text: The apprentices of the Clan are taking special training to learn how to land on enemies when jumping from trees.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step... and with a new noodly, harmless friend!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little snake {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

m_c trills softly as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} eye a patch of clovers just outside of the nursery den. Suddenly, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eyes snap open with surprise -- a four leaved clover? m_c gladly snips it off and wears it proudly!

r_c and m_c relax together in camp as the sun hits them both perfectly. r_c cracks open an eye, and points out a peculiar four leaved clover in a little patch near m_c's tail! m_c's eyes brim with happiness as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the little thing!.
m_c picks up some moss, and decides to carry it around with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}!

r_c eyes a patch of pretty moss {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it to m_c who tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the unusal gift. r_c starts to tumble into an explanation, but m_c gently takes the moss with a gentle thank-you meow.
m_c rolls around in moss in the early morning, and waltzes around camp covered in moss!
m_c wakes up groggily to r_c ominously pelting {PRONOUN/m_c/object} with moss..!? m_c hisses at r_c, telling {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to scurry off!
m_c seems to have spotted acc_plural, and has decided to snag one up as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a pack of acc_singular collecting near a bush, and calls m_c over to see the acc_plural. Curiously enough. m_c has decided to keep one as a pet.
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a cute, slowly moving snail! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c cooes at the little thing as m_c carries it home.
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, and a dangling worm in their jaws...!?
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a light pink, squirmy little worm! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c cooes at the little thing as m_c carries it home.

r_c watches with exhausted eyes as m_c violently digs a hole off to the side of c_n camp, flinging dirt everywhere. m_c approaches less than a minute later, covered in dirt and with a long worm in their jaws. Mumbled, m_c asks if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can keep {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new friend. Exasperated, r_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} yes and to not dig holes in camp, and then tiredly walks over to clean up m_c's mess.
m_c finds a worm in camp on a rainy day! m_c decides to keep it.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head idly at a bee flying around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head. It doesn't seem to want to sting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, so m_c assumes it wants to be {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friend!.
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a bee! m_c claims it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c calls from behind m_c, and m_c has to leap out of the way of a buzzing bee! m_c shifts to swipe at it... but r_c remarks that it seems oddly friendly. m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
r_c mrrps at m_c, asking {PRONOUN/m_c/object} if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted a pair of acc_singular that they found. m_c says yes, and thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the cool wings!
m_c leaps up at a flying bug {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} found around camp, and catches it with grace! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the acc_singular proudly.
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c sneaks out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wandered into the apprentice's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a few leftover acorns.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wandered into the elder's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a few leftover acorns.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wandered into the warrior's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a few leftover acorns.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wandered into the apprentice's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a few leftover acorns.
m_c received a present, gently weaved acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

Over the past few days, m_c has been adamant on being near a nearby daisy patch. On an early morning, m_c reveals that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been braiding a daisy corsage for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail! m_c flaunts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} work proudly.
m_c notices bamboo growing in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest!

r_c has a wonderful idea for decorating m_c's nest! m_c wakes up in the middle of the night with bamboo brushing {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face. Despite the slight spook it gave m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/mews/mews} to r_c in the morning for the cool surprise!

m_c's eyes sparkle as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/realizes/realize} something wonderful --- {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can propagate the bamboo on the edges of c_n territory, and decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest with it! A week later, m_c is seen sleeping soundly with leafy stalks of bamboo casting shadows on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c grins toothily at a acc_singular that wandered into camp! Instead of diving toward it like anyone would expect a cat to do, m_c decides to befriend it with seeds and nuts.

r_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunches/hunch} down to watch acc_singular nibble at a fat seed! m_c stops r_c before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} pounce, and manages to.. befriend the acc_singular! r_c rolls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, grumbling about wasted food.

As a storm rages and the branches of the forest whip around outside, m_c is tucked up in the medicine cat den, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep anything but restful. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/keep/keeps} seeing flashes of prophecy_list_sight. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} with a shiver, wondering what {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dreams mean for the Clan.

The things {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw today, omen_list_sight... m_c conceals {PRONOUN/m_c/self} in a hidden alcove under branches that drip all the way to the ground, needing privacy as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/consider/considers} what these new omens foretell.

Like a seed just beginning to sprout, m_c is now on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} journey to becoming a full warrior of c_n. With a proud gaze, r_c presents {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} kit with acc_singular. r_c knows that one day m_c will grow big and strong, just like a little seed can grow into a strong tree.
